content:
There are many excellent apps that can help you track your hikes, record your progress, and even provide additional features like trail guides, maps, and community sharing. Here are some popular ones:

1. **AllTrails**: A comprehensive app with a vast library of trails, reviews, and ratings. You can track your hikes, mark trails as completed, and even contribute your own trail reviews.
2. **Gaia GPS**: A powerful GPS navigation app that allows you to track your hikes, mark waypoints, and download maps for offline use. It also offers a large collection of trails and routes.
3. **Hiking Project**: A free app from REI that features a vast trail database, GPS tracking, and the ability to log your hikes and earn badges.
4. **MapMyHike**: A popular app that tracks your hikes, including distance, elevation gain, and route. It also offers a large trail database and community features.
5. **Strava**: While primarily a running and cycling app, Strava also supports hiking and offers GPS tracking, route recording, and community features.
6. ** Guthook Guides**: A suite of apps that offer detailed trail guides, GPS tracking, and offline maps for many popular hiking trails and long-distance routes.
7. **Outdooractive**: A comprehensive app that offers GPS tracking, trail guides, and route planning for hiking, biking, and other outdoor activities.

These apps are available for both iOS and Android devices. You may want to try out a few to see which one works best for you.

Remember to always bring a paper map and compass as a backup, even if you're using an app. And don't forget to respect the trails, other hikers, and the environment!
